event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item:
Wait for a moment in case the responsible restarter is still processing commands. If the condition persists, try refreshing or disabling and enabling the service with svcadm(1M).

If the service remains in the invalid state, this error suggests a defect in the responsible restarter, the configuration repository daemon, or the temporary repository contents. Contact Sun Service with the output of svcs -x, svcs -l restarter_service_fmri, a core file of the restarter, a core file of svc.configd(1M), and a copy of /etc/svc/volatile/svc_nonpersist.db. A core file can be generated by the gcore(1) utility.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The service instance's state is not recognized by the system.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The Solaris Service Manager issues commands for a service to its responsible restarter, which may be the Solaris Service Manager itself. In the course of operations, the the responsible restarter updates the service's state in the non-persistent portion of the repository. If a component failure results in the state update being incorrect, then subsequent operations may fail and require administrative interaction.

The Message ID: SMF-8000-N3 indicates that the service's state is invalid.

See "Predictive Self-Healing" for additional information.

If the above Action doesn't help, use the instructions in document 203634 to place svc.startd in debug mode and contact your service provider.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The service instance's behavior is not well defined; it may or may not have been started or stopped correctly.
event_registry_properties.name: title
